snippet: Raghuram G. Rajan’s calls for widespread and speedy changes to the nation’s economy are being heard by his boss, Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.
abstract: Analysts say India's appointment of Raghuram G Rajan to Finance Ministry chief economic adviser is one of several indicators that the country is becoming serious about tackling its outsized economic problems; Rajan is an outspoken critic who has advocated shifting the financial sector away from state ownership.
lead_paragraph: Raghuram G. Rajan’s calls for widespread and speedy changes to the nation’s economy are being heard by his boss, Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.

headline.seo: Rajan, Adviser to India, Urges Changes to Economy
headline.main: As Its Economy Sags, India Asks a Critic to Come Home and Help Out
headline.print_headline: As Its Economy Sags, India Asks a Critic to Come Home and Help Out
